channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Devastation in Gaza as Israel wages war on Hamas
item.description: The war in Gaza will likely continue until at least the end of the year, an Israeli official warned. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Spain's parliament gives final approval to amnesty law for Catalonia's separatists
item.description: Spain’s Parliament has given final approval to a controversial amnesty law for hundreds of Catalan separatists involved in the illegal and unsuccessful 2017 secession bid

item.title: Russia says it may take extra nuclear deterrence steps if US puts missiles in Europe/Asia
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Skull padlocked to dumbbell fished out of New Orleans waterway
item.description: The fisherman also found a handgun and a gun barrel in the water, police said.

item.title: May 29, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The Israeli military says it established "operational control" over the Philadelphi Corridor, a 14-kilometer (8.7 miles) strip of land along the border between Gaza and Egypt.

item.title: 14 pro-democracy activists convicted, 2 acquitted in Hong Kong's biggest national security case
item.description: Fourteen pro-democracy activists have been convicted in Hong Kong’s biggest national security case by a court that said their plan to effect change through an unofficial primary election would have undermined the government’s authority and created a co...

item.title: Indian space startup Agnikul launches country's second privately built rocket
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Hacking group claims Ticketmaster breach yielding data of 560 million customers
item.description: The hacking group ShinyHunters claims it's breached global events giant Ticketmaster and stolen the details of 560 million customers.

item.title: First day of jury deliberations in Trump New York hush money trial
item.description: The jury in Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial has been dismissed for the day after deliberating for more than four hours on Wednesday.

item.title: After nation's 1st nitrogen gas execution, Alabama set to give man lethal injection for 2 killings
item.description: Alabama is set to execute a man convicted of bludgeoning an elderly couple to death 20 years ago to steal prescription drugs and $140 from their home

item.title: Opinion | Justice Stephen Breyer says (politely) that the SCOTUS majority is doing it all wrong
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Jury in Trump trial to continue deliberating verdict for second day
item.description: The jury in former President Donald Trump's criminal trial in New York will resume their deliberations toward reaching a verdict on Thursday.

item.title: How to survive a bear attack -- or better yet, avoid one altogether
item.description: Encounters with bears do happen. Experts share how to avoid a bear attack -- and how to survive one if you find yourself in the fight of your life.

item.title: Judge largely denies Scott Peterson DNA testing request in bid to prove innocence
item.description: A California judge largely denied a motion by Scott Peterson's defense team for new or additional DNA testing of items in the murder case.

item.title: ‘I was exhausted’: Boston nurse drives off top floor of hospital garage after shift
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 14 Hong Kong pro-democracy activists convicted of subversion
item.description: Since the introduction of a 2020 law imposed by Beijing, Hong Kong authorities have severely limited free speech and assembly under the rubric of maintaining national security.

item.title: May 28, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Global condemnation is mounting over Israel's airstrike on a camp for displaced people in Rafah that killed at least 45 people, many of whom were women and children.

item.title: Massive international police operation takes down ransomware networks, arrests 4
item.description: Police coordinated by the European Union’s justice agency have taken down computer networks responsible for spreading ransomware via infected emails

item.title: Scientists sound alarm as growing threat looms over coastal states: 'We are preparing for the wrong disaster'
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Boston-bound flight aborts takeoff at Reagan National to avoid runway collision
item.description: For the second time in six weeks, a Boston-bound flight was forced to slam on the brakes to avoid a potential collision with another plane at Reagan National Airport.
